body.name: Marple: Twelve New Mysteries
body.description: NATIONAL BESTSELLER"Each author captures Christie—and Marple—perfectly, while also displaying just a bit of her own unique touch. . . . This new and entertaining collection by some of our favorite writers will hook a new group of readers to the formidable Miss Marple." — Rhys Bowen, Washington Post“Marple is the best loved [detective]. Also the most influential. . . . It is Miss Marple who introduced the revolutionary notion that people are essentially the same wherever one goes.” — Los Angeles TimesAgatha Christie’s legendary sleuth, Jane Marple, returns to solve twelve baffling cases in this brand-new collection, penned by a host of acclaimed authors skilled in the fine art of mystery and murderOne doesn't stop at one murder...Jane Marple is an elderly lady from St Mary Mead who possesses an uncanny knack for solving even the most perplexing puzzles. Now, for the first time in 45 years, Agatha Christie’s beloved character returns to the page for a globe-trotting tour of crime and detection.Join Marple as she travels through her sleepy English village and around the world. In St Mary Mead, a Christmas dinner is interrupted by unexpected guests; the Broadway stage in New York City is set for a dangerous improvisation; bad omens surround an untimely death aboard a cruise ship to Hong Kong; and a bestselling writer on holiday in Italy is caught in a nefarious plot. These and other crimes committed in the name of love, jealousy, blackmail, and revenge are ones that only the indomitable Jane Marple can solve.Bringing a fresh twist to the hallmarks of a classic Agatha Christie mystery, these twelve esteemed writers have captured the sharp wit, unique voice, and droll ingenuity of the deceptively demure detective. A triumphant celebration of Christie’s legacy and essential reading for crime lovers, Marple is a timely reminder why Jane Marple remains one of the most famous detectives of all time. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very Enjoyable Stories
reviews.reviewText: If you are a fan of Agatha Christie's mysteries, you will enjoy this book. If you begin reading knowing that the stories are written by various authors, you will quickly settle in and thoroughly enjoy each mystery. The twelve mysteries are interesting and the stories are well-written. I enjoyed the book so much that I plan to keep it and read it again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Of course, cannot truly capture Agatha Christie's Miss Marple
reviews.reviewText: While lovers of Agatha Christie's Miss Marple may welcome an opportunity to revisit her in some new tales of deduction, these efforts cannot be said to quite capture the essence of the original.The stories vary in terms of the timeframe that they choose for Miss Marple, most setting her in a time far beyond that of even her last story ("Sleeping Murder"), and thus in frailer health. In addition, most try to move her out to realms far from St. Mary Mead and its environs -- some more successfully than others. Mostly, however, I felt that these are not stories I will ever want to reread. For a taste of Miss Marple, I will simply return to the original books and short stories that I first read over 55 years ago and continue to enjoy with each re-encounter.Of course, capturing all the characteristics of Miss Marple mysteries in the condensed format of a short story is difficult. But too often I felt as if those details that we associate with Miss Marple were superficially applied rather than integral to the story. The village parallels in these stories -- so important to Miss Marple's deductions -- especially felt rather weak. I would guess that if you are at all like me, you may appreciate these stories as efforts, but not be charmed by them as by the originals.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Good size text. Thrilling and enjoyable stories from one of the best authors.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Somewhat entertaining except for the last story
reviews.reviewText: I was ready to rate this higher until I read the last story.THE AUTHOR HAD ONE JOB, which was to capture the wit, charm and intelligence of our Golden Girl detective.I don’t want to post spoilers, but the last short story was pure trash. Dolly Bantry was too proper and too smart to put herself in that position. Before making the unnamed effort to help Genivieve, she would have confided in Miss Marple for advice on what to do, write a telegram and arrange a call. In all the original Marple stories,that's what Dolly did--she'd summon Jane from wherever and pour her guts out.Also, Miss Marple would NEVER consent to how it ended. This author really did not understand the assignment at all. I wish I could ask back for the fraction of the money for that last story, but it's pure trash and worth nothing. It had a decent start and I was happy to see Dolly again but whew, that ending was hot garbage.Other than that, most of the stories were entertaining and stuck to Marple canon.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars They are good summer reading
reviews.reviewText: Not as good as Cristie but most of the stories are good reading

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Entertaining mystery listening 🎶🔰
reviews.reviewText: I got this novel from my local library ebooks, it is twelve short stories about Miss Maple by twelve different authors. Each story is different with interesting well developed characters lots of action and misdirection leading to each conclusion. As with all multiply book sets some you like better than others. I would highly recommend this novel too fans of Agatha Christie and readers of mystery novels 👍🔰. 2023 👒😀😡🏡I listen 🎶to about 100+ ebooks from my local library to go along with ebooks from Amazon which Alexa reads to me. Happy reading and have fun 🌙😀

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023

reviews.reviewText: Watched a documentary about Agatha Christie on Prime and this book was mentioned.....I knew I simply had to have it, ordered it this morning and it was delivered in the early evening...great service! I am already totally engrossed with Miss Marple, what a treat!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I found all of these short stories very enjoyable, and a welcome change from reading my usual full length novels. All written with respect to A C's Miss Marple and some of her familiar associated characters and settings. Excellent!.

reviews.reviewTitle: Como volver a leer a Agatha Christie otra vez
reviews.reviewText: El libro se estructura en varias historias cortas escritas por varios autores. Se nota que estos han leído las novelas de Miss Marple y tienes la sensación de que vuelves a leer nuevos casos de la spinster de St. Mary Mead. El libro que comento es la versión inglesa de bolsillo. Me llegó en un casi perfecto estado. Totalmente recomendable

reviews.reviewTitle: a must for miss Marple lovers
reviews.reviewText: Highly enjoyable reboot of Miss Marple through twelve new authors. Must read for her legions of fans. Nice to see updates to her character such as her strong disapproval of racism.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the Netherlands on April 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The idea seemed very nice, but all the stories are written by differen authors and the styles are just too different. Some of the authors are not very good. Would not recommend.
